rules: Rule1: If the poacher detection system is in emergency mode, then when it is not the case that the camera's battery being charged results in the GPS sensor receiving a signal implying the tracking system is active, an alert is not sent to the ranger station.

Rule2: Provided that a supervisor initiates manual override, then when it is not true that the camera's battery being charged leads to the GPS sensor receiving a signal resulting in the tracking system being active, an alert does not get sent to the ranger station.
Rule3: Under the condition that the backup generator is active, a power outage does not occur at the control center.
Rule4: In the event that the wildlife camera is functional, then motion of a zebra being captured leads to the tracking system being active.
Rule5: Either the wildlife camera is functional or the infrared sensor is thermally operational.
Rule6: Assuming the infrared sensor is thermally operational, then motion of a zebra being captured implies that the tracking system is active.
Rule7: Whenever the tracking system is active, then under the condition that the system is not undergoing scheduled maintenance, a lion is detectable.
Rule8: If movement of a zebra is detected, then motion of a zebra is captured.
Rule9: Provided that movement of a zebra is detected, a signal is received from the GPS sensor.

Rule10: Either the satellite network is available, or if it is not the case that the GPS sensor receiving a signal leads to the tracking system being active, then a software crash occurs in the analysis algorithm.
Rule11: In the event that it is false that the generator having sufficient fuel implies the backup generator is active, then the generator requires maintenance.

Rule12: Whenever it is not the case that the camera's battery being charged leads to the GPS sensor receiving a signal implying the tracking system is active, then a hardware failure occurs in the memory card.

Rule13: Under the condition that it is false that the camera's battery being charged results in the GPS sensor receiving a signal leading to the tracking system being active, an alert is sent to the ranger station.

Rule14: In the event that it is not true that failing to have either the poacher detection system in emergency mode or a supervisor initiating manual override leads to the authentication system being locked, then a power outage occurs at the control center.
facts: Fact1: The generator has sufficient fuel.
Fact2: Movement of a zebra is detected.
Fact3: The camera's battery is charged.
Fact4: It is not the case that a lion is detectable.
Fact5: The authentication system is not locked.
Fact6: It is not the case that the generator requires maintenance.
Fact7: A hardware failure in the memory card does not hold.
Fact8: A software crash in the analysis algorithm does not occur.
Fact9: The satellite network is not available.
